intro: Arthostema, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or white in color. Arthostema species are often found in coastal areas and are adapted to withstand salty air and strong winds. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and their ability to stabilize soil in challenging environments.
